title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 March 2017 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu> has quit  
04:09 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
06:06 <anamika> has joined #xwiki  
06:07 <anamika> has left #xwiki

08:04 <sgc072> has joined #xwiki

09:16 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <sgc\_072> has quit  
09:55 <msmeria> has quit  
09:57 <vmassol> good morning  
10:00 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <Pbas> Hello, on xwiki 8.4.4, how can I hide (or displaye) applications entries in Applications index pages (/bin/view/Applications/) for normal users?  
11:13 <vmassol> Pbas: hi  
11:13 <Pbas> hi Vincent :)  
11:13 <vmassol> i don't remember the version but yes you can configure the app panel  
11:13 <vmassol> in the admin  
11:14 <tmortagne> Pbas is not talking about the panel I think  
11:14 <vmassol> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Panels%20Application#HApplicationPanel  
11:14 <vmassol> ah sorry  
11:14 <vmassol> read too fast again :)  
11:14 <vmassol> the app index is meant to list all  
11:14 <vmassol> so no you can't  
11:14 <vmassol> unless you modify its script of coruse  
11:15 <Pbas> ok then these screens are differents then: https://snag.gy/NemQSX.jpg  
11:16 <tmortagne> Pbas: if the user does not have view right on that application it will not see it, that's the only way I can think of  
11:16 <vmassol> Pbas: yes they are different  
11:16 <vmassol> actually  
11:16 <Pbas> No I tested this way: it doesn't work  
11:16 <vmassol> that the "raison d'etre" of the app index :)  
11:16 <vmassol> since the app panel doesn't contain eveyrthing  
11:16 <Pbas> (maybe I must hide all application pages)  
11:16 <vmassol> we needed a way to list all apps present in the wiki  
11:16 <vmassol> now  
11:17 <vmassol> the other way is simple  
11:17 <vmassol> you have 2 options  
11:17 <vmassol> 1) you filter yourself the app you wish to see by changing the sript  
11:17 <vmassol> 2) you modify the UIX of the apps you don't want to see under some conditions  to include some #if  
11:17 <vmassol> as we do for example for the scheduler app  
11:17 <vmassol> (only admins see it for ex)  
11:18 <vmassol> or  
11:18 <tmortagne> Pbas: It definitely work with view right  
11:18 <vmassol> 3 you put permissions on their pages  
11:18 <tmortagne> but you have to do it at space level probably, not just the home page of the application  
11:18 <Pbas> ty I will try your solution 2 (bc the one I don't knwo how to do it)  
11:18 <vmassol> permissions are better than hiding IMO  
11:19 <Pbas> yes tmortagne (it is what I though later :) )  
11:19 <vmassol> if what you're after is to only make them not listed for some category of users  
11:19 <Pbas> no it is for all normal user (non admin)  
11:20 <Pbas> ok thxs  
11:20 <vmassol> 3 is even simpler I think  
11:20 <tmortagne> for example by default only admins have access to the scheduler and if you log out you won't see the scheduler in the list anymore  
11:21 <Pbas> yes then, probably the most "clean" solution  
11:22 <tmortagne> vmassol: there is no if in the uix of the scheduler, just right setup at space level  
11:22 <tmortagne> $services.uix.getExtensions API automatically filter uix the current user cannot see  
11:23 <Pbas> (I start with "Nested Pages Migration")  
11:24 <vmassol> tmortagne: yes I know but using an #if should also work  
11:24 <vmassol> it should work at least for the app panel (need to checl the index script)  
11:24 <vmassol> since the app panel will only display the entry if the label is not empty for ex  
11:25 <tmortagne> I don't see the point in such a hack, if user is not allowed to see the application in the list he should probably don't have access to it  
11:25 <vmassol> I agree  
11:25 <vmassol> but you may have various needs  
11:25 <vmassol> not just based on user permissions  
11:25 <Pbas> Hide page and childs work well :)  
11:25 <vmassol> yes but not nice  
11:25 <vmassol> since it's also hidden for admins  
11:25 <Pbas> and if I want add a custom application?  
11:25 <vmassol> depends what you want Pbas  
11:26 <vmassol> Pbas: then register it in a UIX  
11:26 <vmassol> see n  
11:26 <Pbas> how do you did taht?  
11:26 <vmassol> éhttp://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionPoint/  
11:26 <Pbas> thzt.  
11:26 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionPoint/  
11:26 <vmassol> and http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionPoint/AddApplicationUIX  
11:26 <Pbas> that  
11:27 <Pbas> ok  
11:27 <vmassol> which BTW needs to be updated  
11:27 <Pbas> ty  
11:27 <vmassol> since it's no longer only the app panel  
11:27 <vmassol> but also the app index  
11:28 <Pbas> thxs I will resume your nice answers in my user list mail :)  
11:29 <vmassol> haha  
11:29 <vmassol> there's another way Pbas  
11:29 <vmassol> I've just read the code for Applications.WebHome (ie app index)  
11:29 <vmassol> it uses:  
11:29 <vmassol>     #displayAppEntries('org.xwiki.platform.panels.Applications', '')  
11:30 <Pbas> yes I saw that but I didn't manage to use it  
11:30 <vmassol> the second param is the doc containing the config of the app panel  
11:31 <vmassol> so you should be able to have exactly the same display as the app panel if you wish  
11:31 <vmassol> ofc this means you'll need to handle potential merges when upgrading in the future :)  
11:32 <Pbas> I already have some (maybe too much) ;-))  
11:33 <vmassol> testing locally  
11:33 <vmassol> for my own knowledge  
11:33 <vmassol> although this is a bit hackish  
11:33 <vmassol> just found that this code is really not coded well  
11:33 <vmassol> the app index was hacked in apparently :)  
11:34 <vmassol> ok works  
11:34 <vmassol>     #set ($configDoc = $xwiki.getDocument($services.model.createDocumentReference('', 'PanelsCode', 'ApplicationsPanelConfiguration')))  
11:34 <vmassol>     #displayAppEntries('org.xwiki.platform.panels.Applications' $configDoc)  
11:34 <vmassol> instead of  
11:34 <vmassol> #displayAppEntries('org.xwiki.platform.panels.Applications', '')  
11:34 <vmassol> P  
11:35 <vmassol> (without the P ;))  
11:35 <vmassol> anyway this is jsut a FYI :)  
11:35 <Pbas> cool I think I use it then  
11:36 <vmassol> it may not be the best  
11:36 <vmassol> for example if you don't want a search to return results from an app for normal users  
11:36 <vmassol> so I still think that from what you told us that you should use permissions on the app space  
11:37 <vmassol> (same as what is done for the scheduler app)  
11:38 <Pbas> yes right  
11:38 <Pbas> but I must copy your code (probably need it in another place)  
11:48 <flashdel> has quit  
12:46 <gdelhumeau> is someone working on https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-14092?

13:30 <vmassol> I meant 9.0.x and 9.1.x ofc :)  
13:32 <vmassol> starting to work on https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1580 since it's becoming more and more important

14:03 <sgc\_072> Is there a shortcut key for annotations (ctrl + M)?  
14:03 <vmassol> yes ctrl+M :)  
14:04 <vmassol> sgc\_072: see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Annotations%20Application  
14:04 <sgc\_072> Hi vmassol , ok I should see it first. :)  
14:12 <sgc072> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <sgc\_072> has quit  
14:26 <vipul\_johri> has quit  
14:35 <vmassol> still running XE functional tests locally.... started one hour ago... that really takes a lot of time...  
14:38 <vmassol> I think I'll just commit it and wait for the CI  
14:39 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: please do not forget to document https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-14116  
14:40 <sgc072> is now known as <sgc\_072>  
14:58 <sgc\_072> vmassol,  yeah got it :)  
14:59 <vmassol> cool  
15:02 <sgc\_072> One more doubt I have is how rendering transformation is used for creating links to a page. I know it may has something to do with source code. Please guide me a little.  
15:04 <tmortagne> sgc\_072: translation job is to modify the XDOM, one of the many modification they can do is put a LinkBlock in it which will be rendered as a link by the html renderer  
15:04 <tmortagne> sgc\_072: transformation job is to modify the XDOM, one of the many modification they can do is put a LinkBlock in it which will be rendered as a link by the html renderer  
15:05 <vmassol> sgc\_072: ex of a transformation: http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Extending#HAddinganewTransformation  
15:05 <vmassol> architecture: http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Architecture  
15:06 <vmassol> list of transformation examples: http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Transformations  
15:17 <sgc\_072> has quit  
15:21 <sgc072> has joined #xwiki  
15:24 <vmassol> going to work on extracting the blog app from XE  
15:29 <sgc072> is now known as <sgc\_072>  
15:31 <sgc\_072> So that means that the whole rendering thing uses java. :P  
15:33 <sgc\_072> I know the basics. :P  
15:33 <acotiuga> has quit  
15:34 <vmassol> yes xwiki is coded in java  
15:34 <vmassol> (for backend)

15:51 <sgc072> has joined #xwiki  
16:09 <gdelhumeau\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:13 <sgc072> has quit  
16:29 <vmassol> we've gone the full circle now ...  
16:30 <vmassol> we had a blog app not in core and a jira for it  
16:30 <vmassol> we merged it in xwiki github  
16:30 <vmassol> and now we're extracting it out and recreating a jira for it  
16:30 <vmassol> :)  
16:36 <vmassol> BTW  
16:36 <vmassol> I want to thank whoever put this comment in the blog-ui pom.xml :)  
16:36 <vmassol>   <!-- If someone has to change the ID, he must update org.xwiki.platform.blog.internal.BlogUpgradeEventListener to  
16:36 <vmassol>        consider the new ID as well -->  
16:36 <vmassol> <artifactId>xwiki-platform-blog-ui</artifactId>  
16:36 <vmassol> very useful!  
16:38 <tmortagne> probably Guillaume  
16:38 <gdelhumeau\_> I'm glad it's useful :)  
16:38 <vmassol> however getPreviousVersion() will not work  
16:39 <vmassol> fixing it  
16:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you remember what are previousExtensions in  
16:40 <vmassol> public void onEvent(Event event, Object installedExtension, Object previousExtensions)  
16:40 <vmassol> for ExtensionUpgradedEvent  
16:41 <vmassol> checking sources  
16:41 <tmortagne> whatever is replaced by this extension  
16:41 <vmassol> why can there be several?  
16:42 <tmortagne> because you could replace several extensions  
16:42 <vmassol> ok  
16:42 <vmassol> so gdelhumeau\_ 's code is not correct I think  
16:42 <vmassol> I mean not necessary  
16:42 <vmassol> he has:  
16:42 \* vmassol sent a long message: vmassol\_2017-03-23\_15:42:47.txt - https://matrix.org/\_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/zhNQsdguuvxitoSNiTIsmAWI  
16:43 <vmassol> the "if" seems not necessary  
16:43 <tmortagne> you will have to ask gdelhumeau\_ why he does that, not me :)  
16:44 <vmassol> from what I see the blog will only replace one previous extension anyway  
16:44 <vmassol> s/see/understand  
16:45 <tmortagne> if the blog is not bundled in XE anymore then yes I think so  
16:45 <msmeria> has quit  
16:45 <vmassol> so we could just take the first element and not check the id  
16:45 <tmortagne> if it's bunled in XE then it might match XE ui-all during an upgrade of XE  
16:45 <vmassol> ah  
16:45 <vmassol> ok then I wasn't understanding previousExtensions  
16:46 <vmassol> I'll handle it sefly  
16:46 <vmassol> \*safely  
16:46 <tmortagne> again it's whatever is replaces, and ui-all declare the blog as feature  
16:46 <tmortagne> you can't have several extension with the same feature in the same namespace  
16:46 <tmortagne> you can't have several extensions with the same feature in the same namespace  
16:48 <tmortagne> anyway whatever is the matched previous extension all you want to know is the version from what I see  
16:49 <tmortagne> and you don't restart from 1.0 in the new Blog extension  
16:50 <tmortagne> since XE and blog version used to be in sync you don't need to be sure it's the blog extension and not ui-all  
16:50 <vmassol> sure, I'm playing it safe anyway  
17:06 <vmassol> @All: please don't modify the blog app on master FTM :)  
17:09 <vmassol> ah too bad  
17:10 <vmassol> I wanted to depend on 8.4-7 parent pom  
17:10 <vmassol> (contrib parent pom)  
17:11 <vmassol> but the recent addition of gdelhumeau\_  related to blog events is preventing that  
17:11 <vmassol> it needs org.xwiki.eventstream.RecordableEvent for example...  
17:11 <gdelhumeau\_> all I was trying to do is to run a migrator when the blog app is upgraded from a version that did not handle the blogupdatelistener  
17:12 <vmassol> so I guess FTM I'll need to release a new version of the contrib parent pom in version 9.2-rc-1  
17:13 <tmortagne> why do you need to release contrib blog now ? you could wait for 9.2  
17:13 <vmassol> or wait for 9.2  
17:13 <vmassol> yes  
17:13 <vmassol> but I need to build it  
17:14 <vmassol> to verify all is working  
17:14 <gdelhumeau> how I'm both in riot and irc, and I see different messages  
17:14 <tmortagne> the parent is just a parent, you can override ${platform.version} for now  
17:14 <gdelhumeau> there is a big lag between irc and riot too  
17:14 <vmassol> I could build the parent pom locally  
17:14 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: riot filters technical stuff (like people leaving etc)  
17:14 <vmassol> and not release it  
17:14 <tmortagne> there is other stuff ?  
17:14 <vmassol> indeed tmortagne , I'll try that  
17:14 <tmortagne> ok  
17:14 <OSIMasson1> has quit  
17:14 <gdelhumeau> there is a big lag between irc and riot too:  
17:15 <gdelhumeau> "all I was trying to do is to run a migrator when the blog app is upgraded from a version that did not handle the blogupdatelistener" was posted a minutes before it appears in riot  
17:15 <vmassol> haha gdelhumeau  has used some new mockito constructs too apparenrtly :)  
17:15 <vmassol> adding an explicit mockito dep then....  
17:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: he probably did not had a choice actually  
17:15 <tmortagne> some API changed in mockito  
17:15 <tmortagne> some APIs changed in mockito  
17:15 <vmassol> like ArgumentMatchers ?  
17:15 <tmortagne> escpecially matchers yes  
17:15 <vmassol> ok  
17:15 <tmortagne> that's the main thing that changed actually  
17:16 <tmortagne> to no depend on hamcrest anymore  
17:37 <vmassol> hmm getting collissions  
17:37 <vmassol> need to find where they come from  
17:37 <vmassol> (in func tests)  
17:37 <vmassol> build is passing though  
17:38 <tmortagne> looks like you end up with two version of commons-digester-1.8 in the WAR  
17:38 <tmortagne> looks like you end up with two versions of commons-digester-1.8 in the WAR  
17:38 <vmassol> yes and there are several more  
17:38 <tmortagne> looks like you end up with two versions of commons-digester in the WAR  
17:39 <vmassol> maybe causedby the parent pom version vs platform.version defined  
17:39 <vmassol> yes  
17:39 <tmortagne> try commons.version instead  
17:39 <vmassol> indeed good idea  
17:39 <tmortagne> otherwise you might have 8.4 commons jar and 9.2 platform jars  
17:39 <vmassol> yep  
17:40 <tmortagne> IRC not error, been a while seen I saw one of those  
17:41 <tmortagne> s/not/bot/  
17:43 <vmassol> same problem, actually even more collissions ;)  
17:43 <vmassol> I'll debug later on  
17:44 <vmassol> ok so if I cannot release it now  
17:44 <vmassol> then I'll need to remove blog from XE on master and remember to ad it back mater on  
17:44 <vmassol> \*later  
17:45 <vmassol> well =i could use a snapshot I guess  
17:45 <tmortagne> it's not critical to have a release of the contrib extensio before removing it from XE  
17:45 <vmassol> I'll do that  
17:45 <vmassol> since ci is building blog it should be ok  
17:46 <tmortagne> installing 9.1 version of the blog in 9.2 will work ine  
17:46 <tmortagne> s/ine/fine/  
17:55 <mflorea> has quit  
17:59 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
18:03 <vmassol> BTW guys, when we move out modules from platform to contrub  
18:03 <vmassol> \*contrib  
18:04 <vmassol> it means we also loose validation for them  
18:04 <vmassol> ah no  
18:04 <vmassol> forget that  
18:04 <vmassol> the webstadard tests will still run on them  
18:04 <vmassol> (if they're bundled in XE)  
18:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: i'm removing the blog from xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki-all features list  
18:08 <vmassol> I hope this is ok  
18:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: do you remove the blog from XE ?  
18:10 <vmassol> no  
18:10 <tmortagne> then why do you remove the feature ?  
18:11 <vmassol> well I noticed that we don't have in this list ckeditor, the tour, the help center, etc  
18:11 <tmortagne> xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki-all is supposed to indicate all features it covers  
18:11 <vmassol> (hence my question)  
18:11 <tmortagne> that's because people forgot to add them  
18:11 <vmassol> ok  
18:12 <vmassol> so if people install the all in one XAR they'll miss them indeed, not nice  
18:13 <tmortagne> we should probably get rid of \*-all XAR anyway sinc they are not enough anymore to install the UI  
18:14 <tmortagne> (since we don't embbed contrib extension jars in the XE WAR anymore)  
18:14 <vmassol> they are the only way to install XWiki offline right now AFAIK  
18:14 <tmortagne> not even  
18:14 <tmortagne> again it's not ebough anymore  
18:14 <vmassol> they are the closest  
18:15 <vmassol> so insteaf of removing them we probabmy need to fix them  
18:15 <vmassol> so instead of removing them we probably need to fix them instead  
18:16 <tmortagne> not sure what you want to fix, we can't embbed JARs extensions in a XAR  
18:16 <tmortagne> we need a different system for offline  
18:16 <vmassol> indeed so we'd need instructions to get those jars  
18:16 <vmassol> (and their deps)  
18:16 <vmassol> and make them avail  
18:17 <vmassol> which optional extension has jars rigt now?  
18:17 <vmassol> the blog has now  
18:17 <vmassol> what else?  
18:17 <vmassol> ckeditor probvably with webjar  
18:17 <tmortagne> most of them  
18:17 <tmortagne> because of webjars yes  
18:19 <tmortagne> the best would be a pack to extract in <permdir>/extension/repository/  
18:20 <tmortagne> that way you can use the DW  
18:20 <tmortagne> not need for crappy ui-all XARs  
18:20 <vmassol> yes  
18:22 <vmassol> ok waiting for CI now to see what I broke... crossing fingers ;)  
18:23 <sorinello\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:26 <sorinello> has quit  
18:33 <vmassol> hmm +33 test failures in ui tests after the admin user move to simple user... http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/3013/  
18:34 <vmassol> checking one  
18:35 <vmassol> ah yes  
18:35 <vmassol> the issue is editWiki()  
18:35 <vmassol> since the user is simple there isn't this menu entry  
18:35 <vmassol> :)
